job_description:
Thematic and research challenges

Opportunities and interest from educational researchers to make use of learning design and analytics are growing fast, whether to inform students to improve their success, or to inform teachers on the impact of learning design decisions. The learning design and learning analytics developments are now strongly relying on the increasing role of data collection and sensemaking.

The expected focus activity will be especially set on:

  • collection, interpretation and learning data from various sources : learning platforms, experiential environments, including data that can reflect affective and emotional states of learners, as well as fatigue and stress.
  • hybrid extracted data and knowledge models - possibly based upon domain ontologies and symbolic AI models - to define and develop decision aids for any stakeholder (learner, teacher, training managerâ¦) 
  • develop complementary expertise in explanation-based approaches relying on multiple models of domain, learner and educational process.

The research will be relying on (and fed from) real situations and educational frameworks, as well as data issued from the Learning Analytics and Digital Education global initiative that has been launched at the level of IMT group. The candidate is expected to participate and take leadership in the domain at national and international level.

Eco-system and context

IMT Atlantique internationally recognized for the quality of its research, is a leading technological university under the authority of the Ministry of Industry and Digital Technologies, ranked in the three main international rankings (THE, SHANGHAI, QS). 

The position is open on the campus of Brest within the Computer Sciences Department, as well as attached to the CNRS Research Unit Lab-STICC and its research team MOTEL 

IMT Atlantique has privileged relationships with major industrial national and international partners, as well as a dense network of SMEs, start-ups and innovation networks. With 290 permanent faculty members, 2000 students among which 300 PhD students, IMT Atlantique produces every year 1000 publications and raises 18Mâ¬ of research funding.

Education

The education program of IMT Atlantique has been recognized as amongst the most innovative in French High Education and Research, and offers large possibilities of developing innovative engineering curriculum and educational approach. 

The candidate will contribute to the teaching of computer science, data sciences and/or human centered systems. They will be invited to propose related new educational projects, programs and methodologies, especially inspired by and supported by industrial requirements and partnerships.
